author: wsjcom
title: A Lack of Skin in the Game Boosts Student-Loan Losses
text:
There is a relatively simple solution to reducing U.S. student-loan defaults and simultaneously reducing the federal government (i.e., the taxpayer) risk for default without encroaching on the role of the federal government in the process (“Fight Over Student Loans Intensifies,” U.S. News, March 10): The federal government can provide no-interest loans to colleges to be used for student loans, in any amount requested.
